features: ✅ QUICK AND PAINLESS — MyHelp wound closure strips keep the wound closed providing it with strong and secure support. The stitches bandage helps to heal small cuts in days and protects the wound from exposure.

✅ FIRST AID KIT MUST-HAVE — The laceration closure kit includes all you need to close the wound effectively. It comes with four wound closure devices, eight cleaning wipes, and four adhesive dressings. All instruments are individually packed and made of hypoallergenic materials.

✅ STITCHLESS — Having stitches for wounds in your first aid kit may save you a trip to the ER and reduce secondary trauma. Emergency laceration closures are a must-have for those living far away from a hospital, working on a farm, and who like outdoor activities.
✅ EASY TO APPLY AND REMOVE — Butterfly bandages are designed to be easy to use which makes them ideal for kids. Following the instructions, you can apply or remove butterfly stitches in seconds.

✅ REDUCE SCARRING — Unlike traditional stitches, butterfly bandages for wound closure thanks to their non-invasive technique goes without any punctures. In this way, the chances of infection are reduced, and the formation of scarring is minimized.
✅ MIX PACK — You’ll get two types of first aid butterfly closures that allows you to use them on various types of wounds. MyHelp butterfly strips — the #1 choice for your first aid kit!

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Previous page Next page 1 The Kit Includes 2 PU Wound Closure Strips 3 Non-woven Closure Strips 4 Sterile Pads 5 Cleaning Wipes
Previous page Next page 1 Easy to Use 2 Step One 3 Step Two 4 Step Three 5 Step Four

How long do wound closure strips stay in place? The wound closure will remain secure for as much time as necessary, as long as you keep it away from water. However, we recommend wearing the stitches bandage for no more than 10 days. What types of wounds are these devices suitable for? This laceration closure kit is suitable for various types of wounds, such as incisions, lacerations, and cuts. The larger device can close wounds up to 2.4 inches, the smaller - up to 1.2 inches. You can also apply two or more devices simultaneously. How to apply MyHelp wound closure devices. Our butterfly bandages are very easy to apply. Just ensure you've cleaned and disinfected the injured area, and follow the instructions. The application only takes seconds. Do laceration closures reduce scarring? Butterfly bandages for wound closure are effective healing devices that don’t require puncturing the skin. Therefore, these non-invasive devices, unlike traditional stitches, cause minimal scarring.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Used to close up a 7 inch long, gaping thigh wound (fat exposure and all). Much cheeper than urgent care, and as long as this lasts holding the now previously gaping wound, not sure why I would ever bother with stitches!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great for my prep kit!
reviews.reviewText: I saw my plastic surgeon using these for a surgery so I knew they were a must for my prepping kit! Arrived on time in perfect condition. Greta to have on hand w kids also!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great for an emergency
reviews.reviewText: I had to use these last summer when my nephew fell and split his forehead. We cleaned the wound which was a small gash about half an inch long and applied one of these stick-on sutures and took him to the dr to check if he needed stitches. Dr took a look and said just keep it on and it should heal with less scarring than if he stitched it.After this I had to buy some more to keep on hand in the first aid kit. Would recommend!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Hope to never need them, but glad I have them
reviews.reviewText: The review of this product is for the quality of the product and not the functionality. I purchased these for my vacation home that is located far away from a hospital. I have said that if an injury occurs that requires these bandages, a visit to the ER is also necessary. However these seem like something that would be good to have until we can seek the professional medical attention.The kit comes with two different sizes bandages as well as alcohol swabs and large gauze bandages to place over the wound. All in all, this is a great kit that has everything you would need to close the wound. But again these are fairly heavy duty wounds. I don’t think I would use these without an additional visit to the ER

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars So much better than butterfly bandaids!
reviews.reviewText: My husband takes blood thinners which means every little scrape becomes a serious injury. He compounds the problem because he is an outdoorsman and hard worker who can't sit still, exposing himself and his body to a lot of opportunity for injuries. I've had to mend him quickly many times in the past couple years so when I saw this kit I was very excited at the concept. Instead of fumbling with multiple butterfly band aids to close a longer incision, this allows you to place the tape and pull it tight with just a couple of quick moves. Makes me feel like an expert!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Looks simple to use, hopefully never have to use it, lol

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Exactly what I needed
reviews.reviewText: A friend who has thin skin as a health issue needed something to close a tear quickly and this was the perfect solution.These work well & are easy to handle & use. I will definitely purchase them again.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2023
reviews.reviewText: They are very easy to use
